question.long: Do vaccines increase the risk of developing autism or ASD?

description: Results from studies evaluating the impact of vaccines on the development of autism or ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder).

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the effects of vaccines on autism

no.description: The literature suggests that vaccines do not cause autism

towards_no.description: The literature suggests that vaccines probably don't cause autism, but more research is needed

towards_yes.description: The literature suggests that vaccines may cause autism, but more research is needed

yes.description: The literature suggests that vaccines cause autism

no.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of the vaccines evaluated on the risk of developing autism

no_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of the vaccines evaluated on the risk of developing autism, unlike what is reported in the literature

no_but_mixed_results.description: The results of the paper show no significant overall effect of the vaccines evaluated on the risk of developing autism, but there are mixed results on specific cases

maybe.description: The results of the paper suggest that the vaccines evaluated might have an effect on the risk of developing autism, but the evidence is not strong enough to conclude

yes_but_low_confidence.description: The results of the paper suggest that the vaccines evaluated may increase the risk of developing autism, but the evidence is not strong

yes_but_small_effect.description: The results of the paper suggest that the vaccines evaluated may have a small effect on the risk of developing autism

yes_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that the vaccines evaluated may increase the risk of developing autism, unlike what is reported in the literature

yes.description: The results of the paper suggest that the vaccines evaluated increase the risk of developing autism

papers.title: Measles Vaccines: a review of adverse events
papers.quote: The alleged associations between measles vaccination and [...] autism are based upon weak science and have largely been refuted by a large volume of stronger work

papers.title: MMR and Autism
papers.quote: We believe that this Swedish ecological study of autism cannot be taken to support the hypothesis of an association between MMR and autistic disorder

papers.title: No evidence for measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine-associated inflammatory bowel disease or autism in a 14-year prospective study
papers.quote: Over a decade‚Äôs effort to detect all severe adverse events associated with MMR vaccine could find no data supporting the hypothesis that it would cause pervasive developmental disorder

papers.title: RETRACTED: Ileal-lymphoid-nodular hyperplasia, non-specific colitis, and pervasive developmental disorder in children
papers.quote: Onset of behavioural symptoms was associated, by the parents, with measles, mumps, and rubella vaccination [...] Behavioural disorders included autism (nine)

notes.title: Data manipulation
notes.description: Symptoms before vaccination deliberately hidden, changes in reported measurement dates, data selection, patients recruited through anti-vaccine campaigners

notes.title: Undisclosed conflict of interest
notes.description: The first author was secretly funded by a lawyer pursuing vaccine‚Äêinjury litigation

notes.title: Anti-vaccine activist
notes.description: The first author is an anti-vaccine activist that directed the movie "Vaxxed: From Cover-Up to Catastrophe"

papers.title: Autism and measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine: no epidemiological evidence for a causal association
papers.quote: Our analyses do not support a causal association between MMR vaccine and autism

papers.title: Autism and measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine: No epidemiological evidence for a causal association
papers.quote: Our analyses do not support a causal association between MMR vaccine and autism

papers.title: Autism and Measles-Mumps-Rubella Vaccination
papers.quote: Currently, the weight of the available epidemiological and related evidence does not support a causal association between MMR vaccine, or any other vaccine or vaccine constituent, and autism

papers.title: Autism: a novel form of mercury poisoning
papers.quote: Due to the extensive parallels between autism and HgP, the likelihood of a causal relationship is great

notes.title: Non-peer-reviewed journal
notes.description: Medical Hypotheses is a not-conventionally-peer-reviewed journal designed to promote unconventional ideas

notes.title: Anti-vaccine organization
notes.description: All the authors are part of an organization (SafeMinds) dedicated to promoting the idea that mercury and vaccines cause autism

notes.title: Most vaccines now mercury-free
notes.description: The paper focuses on the effects of mercury, which has now been removed from most vaccines

papers.title: Do children who become autistic consult more often after MMR vaccination?
papers.quote: MMR vaccination does not appear to cause any dramatic decline in the behaviour of children who subsequently become autistic

papers.title: Measles-Mumps-Rubella Vaccine and Autistic Spectrum Disorder: Report From the New Challenges in Childhood Immunizations Conference Convened in Oak Brook, Illinois, June 12‚Äì13, 2000
papers.quote: The available evidence does not support the hypothesis that MMR vaccine causes autism or associated disorders

papers.title: MMR and autism: further evidence against a causal association
papers.quote: Our results do not support the hypothesis that MMR or measles-containing vaccines cause autism at any time after vaccination

papers.title: MMR, autism and inflammatory bowel disease: responding to patient concerns using an evidence‚Äêbased framework
papers.quote: There is no convincing evidence that the MMR vaccine is associated with autism

papers.title: Mumps, measles, and rubella vaccine and the incidence of autism recorded by general practitioners: a time trend analysis
papers.quote: These data provide evidence against a causal association between MMR vaccination and the risk of autism

papers.title: No Evidence for A New Variant of Measles-Mumps-Rubella‚ÄìInduced Autism
papers.quote: No evidence was found to support a distinct syndrome of MMR-induced autism

papers.title: Time Trends in Autism and in MMR Immunization Coverage in California
papers.quote: These data do not suggest an association between MMR immunization among young children and an increase in autism occurrence

papers.title: A Population-Based Study of Measles, Mumps, and Rubella Vaccination and Autism
papers.quote: This study provides strong evidence against the hypothesis that MMR vaccination causes autism

papers.title: Autism and MMR vaccination in North London; no causal relationship
papers.quote: These results provide no support for a 'new-variant' form of autism associated with bowel problems or regression and further evidence against any involvement of MMR vaccination in the initiation of autism

papers.title: Measles, Mumps and Rubella Vaccine, Autism and Inflammatory Bowel Disease
papers.quote: Since there is no evidence to suggest that MMR is associated with the development of autism

papers.title: Measles, mumps, and rubella vaccination and bowel problems or developmental regression in children with autism: population study
papers.quote: These findings provide no support for an MMR associated "new variant" form of autism with developmental regression

papers.title: MMR and autism: an overview of the debate to date
papers.quote: Despite [...] the overwhelming scientific opinion that argues against a link between MMR vaccine and ASD, the controversy continues

papers.title: MMR and autism: moving from controversy toward consensus
papers.quote: Controlled studies have failed to find an association between recent or any receipt of the MMR vaccine and ASD

papers.title: MMR vaccination and autism: is there a link?
papers.quote: Currently, the weight of the available epidemiological and related evidence does not support a causal link between MMR vaccine and autism

papers.title: MMR vaccine and autism: a review of the evidence for a causal association
papers.quote: The weight of the currently available epidemiological and related evidence argues against a causal association

papers.title: Neurologic Disorders After Measles-Mumps-Rubella Vaccination
papers.quote: We did not identify any association between MMR vaccination and encephalitis, aseptic meningitis, or autism

papers.title: Potential viral pathogenic mechanism for new variant inflammatory bowel disease
papers.quote: The data confirm an association between the presence of measles virus and gut pathology in children with developmental disorder

notes.title: Omitted information
notes.description: Crucial information such as participants' vaccination status or the interval between vaccination and biopsy collection was suspiciously omitted from the analysis

notes.title: Controversial author
notes.description: One of the authors, Andrew Wakefield, was found to have undeclared conflicts of interest and to have manipulated evidence in related work, he is also an anti-vaccine activist

notes.title: Vaccine VS natural infection
notes.description: No analysis has been done to determine whether it was vaccine virus or natural measles virus

papers.title: Vaccine adverse events: separating myth from reality.
papers.quote: Currently, no substantial evidence links measles-mumps-rubella vaccine to autism

papers.title: Association Between Thimerosal-Containing Vaccine and Autism
papers.quote: The results do not support a causal relationship between childhood vaccination with thimerosal-containing vaccines and development of autistic-spectrum disorders

papers.title: Association of Autistic Spectrum Disorder and the Measles, Mumps, and Rubella Vaccine
papers.quote: The current literature does not suggest an association between ASD and the MMR vaccine

papers.title: Autism and thimerosal-containing vaccines
papers.quote: The body of existing data [...] is not consistent with the hypothesis that increased exposure to Thimerosal-containing vaccines is responsible for the apparent increase in the rates of autism

papers.title: Epidemiology and Possible Causes of Autism
papers.quote: These results, based on cumulative incidence in consecutive cohorts, provide conclusive evidence that the MMR vaccine could not have caused the dramatic rise in incidence of autism

papers.title: Measles-mumps-rubella vaccine and the development of autism
papers.quote: No epidemiologic evidence suggests an association between MMR vaccination and autism. Moreover, epidemiologic evidence against such an association is compelling

papers.title: Measles-Mumps-Rubella Vaccine and the Development of Autism or Inflammatory Bowel Disease: The Controversy Should End
papers.quote: The available epidemiological and scientific evidence does not support a causal association between the MMR vaccine and autism

papers.title: Measles, mumps, rubella (MMR) vaccine
papers.quote: Epidemiological studies do not support a causative link between MMR and autism

papers.title: MMR and autistic enterocolitis: consistent epidemiological failure to find an association
papers.quote: How many more well-powered epidemiological investigations of representative samples will be necessary for this hypothesis to be completely discarded?

papers.title: Safety of Thimerosal-Containing Vaccines: A Two-Phased Study of Computerized Health Maintenance Organization Databases
papers.quote: No consistent significant associations were found between thimerosal-containing vaccines and neurodevelopmental outcomes

papers.title: There is little evidence that combined vaccination against measles, mumps, and rubella is associated with autism
papers.quote: The authors found no evidence that the combined measles, mumps and rubella vaccination is associated with the development of autism

papers.title: Thimerosal and Autism?
papers.quote: On the basis of current evidence, we consider it improbable that thimerosal and autism are linked

papers.title: Thimerosal and the Occurrence of Autism: Negative Ecological Evidence From Danish Population-Based Data
papers.quote: Our ecological data do not support a correlation between thimerosal-containing vaccines and the incidence of autism

papers.title: Unintended events following immunization with MMR: a systematic review
papers.quote: Exposure to MMR is unlikely to be associated with [...] autism

papers.title: Age at First Measles-Mumps-Rubella Vaccination in Children With Autism and School-Matched Control Subjects: A Population-Based Study in Metropolitan Atlanta
papers.quote: Overall, the age at time of first MMR administration was similar among case and control children

papers.title: Does the MMR triple vaccine cause autism?
papers.quote: There is overwhelming evidence that MMR vaccine is not causally related to autism

papers.title: Exploring the evidence surrounding the debate on MMR and autism
papers.quote: This article looks at the evidence for a link between MMR and autism, finding that while a plausible hypothesis has been constructed, there is no substantive evidence for such a link and that the quality of this evidence is, in many cases, poor

papers.title: Immunizations, immunology, and autism
papers.quote: We summarize from multiple population-based studies and extensive review committee reports that neither immunization nor thimerosal exposure has been conclusively linked to autism

papers.title: MMR Vaccination and Autism
papers.quote: A review of the literature revealed no convincing scientific evidence to support a causal relationship between the use of MMR vaccines and autism

papers.title: MMR vaccination and pervasive developmental disorders: a case-control study
papers.quote: Our findings suggest that MMR vaccination is not associated with an increased risk of pervasive developmental disorders

papers.title: MMR vaccine and autism: an update of the scientific evidence
papers.quote: The evidence now is convincing that the measles-mumps-rubella vaccine does not cause autism or any particular subtypes of autistic spectrum disorder

papers.title: Neurotoxic effects of postnatal thimerosal are mouse strain dependent
papers.quote: Profound behavioral and neuropathologic disturbances were observed after postnatal thimerosal in SJL/J (H-2À¢) mice

notes.title: Most vaccines now mercury-free
notes.description: The paper focuses on the effects of mercury, which has now been removed from most vaccines

papers.title: No evidence for links between autism, MMR and measles virus
papers.quote: No increased risk of AD following exposures to wild measles and vaccinations with monovalent measles, and Urabe or Jeryl-Lynn variants of MMR was detected

papers.title: Relationship Between MMR Vaccine and Autism
papers.quote: Based upon the current literature, it appears that there is no relationship between MMR vaccination and the development of autism

papers.title: Review: existing epidemiological evidence does not show an association between mumps, measles, and rubella vaccination and autism
papers.quote: Rates of autistic spectrum disorder (ASD) are not higher in children who receive mumps, measles, and rubella (MMR) vaccination

papers.title: Thimerosal Exposure in Infants and Developmental Disorders: A Prospective Cohort Study in the United Kingdom Does Not Support a Causal Association
papers.quote: We could find no convincing evidence that early exposure to thimerosal had any deleterious effect on neurologic or psychological outcome

papers.title: Thimerosal Exposure in Infants and Developmental Disorders: A Retrospective Cohort Study in the United Kingdom Does Not Support a Causal Association
papers.quote: There was no evidence that thimerosal exposure via DTP/DT vaccines causes neurodevelopmental disorders

papers.title: Thimerosal-Containing Vaccines and Autistic Spectrum Disorder: A Critical Review of Published Original Data
papers.quote: Studies do not demonstrate a link between thimerosal-containing vaccines and ASD

papers.title: Aetiology of autism: findings and questions
papers.quote: The rate of ASD shows no particular association with either the stopping or starting of MMR. [...] The evidence with respect to a possible association with Thimerosal, a preservative in some vaccines, is much more limited but, again, there is no supporting epidemiological evidence of a causal association

papers.title: No effect of MMR withdrawal on the incidence of autism: a total population study
papers.quote: MMR vaccination is most unlikely to be a main cause of ASD

papers.title: Review: vaccines containing thimerosal are not associated with autistic spectrum disorders in children
papers.quote: There is no association between thimerosal-containing vaccines and autism in children

papers.title: Immunizations and Autism: A Review of the Literature
papers.quote: The overwhelming majority showing no causal association between the Measles-Mumps-Rubella vaccine and autism. The vaccine preservative thimerosal has alternatively been hypothesized to have a possible causal role in autism. Again, no convincing evidence was found to support this claim

papers.title: Is There a ‚ÄòRegressive Phenotype‚Äô of Autism Spectrum Disorder Associated with the Measles-Mumps-Rubella Vaccine? A CPEA Study
papers.quote: There was no evidence that onset of autistic symptoms or of regression was related to measles-mumps-rubella vaccination

papers.title: MMR-Vaccine and Regression in Autism Spectrum Disorders: Negative Results Presented from Japan
papers.quote: Our results cast additional doubt on the hypothesis that developmental regression in children with ASD is associated with MMR

papers.title: Pervasive Developmental Disorders in Montreal, Quebec, Canada: Prevalence and Links With Immunizations
papers.quote: No relationship was found between pervasive developmental disorder rates and 1- or 2-dose measles-mumps-rubella immunization schedule

papers.title: Postlicensure epidemiology of childhood vaccination: the Danish experience
papers.quote: MMR vaccine and thimerosal-containing vaccines do not increase the risk of autism

papers.title: Vaccines and the changing epidemiology of autism
papers.quote: There is no scientific evidence that the measles, mumps and rubella (MMR) vaccine or the mercury preservative used in some vaccines plays any part in the aetiology or triggering of autism

papers.title: A Case Series of Children with Apparent Mercury Toxic Encephalopathies Manifesting with Clinical Symptoms of Regressive Autistic Disorders‚àó
papers.quote: These previously normally developing children suffered mercury toxic encephalopathies that manifested with clinical symptoms consistent with regressive ASDs

notes.title: Controversial authors
notes.description: The authors have a long history of highly criticized and even retracted publications, undisclosed conflicts of interest, dishonesty, data manipulation, and revoked medical licenses

notes.title: Most vaccines now mercury-free
notes.description: The paper focuses on the effects of mercury, which has now been removed from most vaccines

papers.title: Early Thimerosal Exposure and Neuropsychological Outcomes at 7 to 10 Years
papers.quote: Our study does not support a causal association between early exposure to mercury from thimerosal-containing vaccines and immune globulins and deficits in neuropsychological functioning

papers.title: Lack of association between Rh status, Rh immune globulin in pregnancy and autism
papers.quote: These findings support the consensus that exposure to ethylmercury in thimerosal is not the cause of the increased prevalence of autism

papers.title: Low-Level Neonatal Thimerosal Exposure: Further Evaluation of Altered Neurotoxic Potential in SJL Mice
papers.quote: Considered together the present results do not indicate pervasive developmental neurotoxicity following vaccine-level thimerosal injections in SJL mice, and provide little if any support for the hypothesis that thimerosal exposure contributes to the etiology of neurodevelopmental disorders

papers.title: Vaccination, seizures and 'vaccine damage'
papers.quote: The weight of epidemiological evidence does not support a relationship between vaccination and childhood epileptic encephalopathies or autism spectrum disorders

papers.title: Vaccines and Autism: Evidence Does Not Support a Causal Association
papers.quote: The current scientific evidence does not support a causal association between MMR vaccine or TCVs and autism

papers.title: Continuing Increases in Autism Reported to California's Developmental Services System
papers.quote: The DDS data do not support the hypothesis that exposure to thimerosal during childhood is a primary cause of autism

papers.title: Lack of Association between Measles Virus Vaccine and Autism with Enteropathy: A Case-Control Study
papers.quote: This study provides strong evidence against association of autism with persistent MV RNA in the GI tract or MMR exposure

papers.title: Measles vaccination and antibody response in autism spectrum disorders
papers.quote: No association between measles vaccination and ASD was shown

papers.title: Regression of language and non‚Äêlanguage skills in pervasive developmental disorders
papers.quote: Thimerosal has no specific association with regressive autism

papers.title: Are Neuropathological Conditions Relevant to Ethylmercury Exposure?
papers.quote: Methodologically sound and rigorous epidemiological studies have largely failed in finding a significant correlation between thimerosal containing vaccines and autism

papers.title: Autism and Vaccination - The Current Evidence
papers.quote: Rigorous scientific studies have not identified links between autism and either thimerosal-containing vaccine or the measles, mumps, and rubella vaccine

papers.title: Neuropsychological Performance 10 Years After Immunization in Infancy With Thimerosal-Containing Vaccines
papers.quote: The lack of consistency among the results of our study [...] suggests that an association between thimerosal exposure through vaccination in infancy and neuropsychological deficits is unlikely or clinically negligible

notes.title: Randomization and blindness
notes.description: This cohort study is based on groups from an earlier clinical trial who were randomly assigned under double-blind conditions

papers.title: Vaccines and Autism: A Tale of Shifting Hypotheses
papers.quote: Twenty epidemiologic studies have shown that neither thimerosal nor MMR vaccine causes autism

papers.title: Closer look at autism and the measles-mumps-rubella vaccine
papers.quote: The evidence presented does not show a causal relationship between the MMR vaccine and autism

papers.title: Does thimerosal or other mercury exposure increase the risk for autism? A review of current literature.
papers.quote: The evidence presented here does not support a causal association between autism and mercury exposure from the preservative thimerosal

papers.title: Hepatitis B Vaccination of Male Neonates and Autism Diagnosis, NHIS 1997‚Äì2002
papers.quote: The results of the study indicate that U.S. male neonates vaccinated with the hepatitis B vaccine prior to 1999 incurred a threefold greater risk for autism diagnosis

papers.title: Lack of Association Between Measles-Mumps-Rubella Vaccination and Autism in Children
papers.quote: The study provides evidence against the association of autism with either MMR or a single measles vaccine

papers.title: MMR vaccine and autism: Is there a link?
papers.quote: The evidence clearly shows that there is no link between vaccination against measles, mumps, and rubella, and an increased risk for the development of a PDD, such as autism

papers.title: On-time Vaccine Receipt in the First Year Does Not Adversely Affect Neuropsychological Outcomes
papers.quote: This study provides the strongest clinical outcomes evidence to date that ontime receipt of vaccines during infancy has no adverse effect on neurodevelopmental outcomes 7 to 10 years later

papers.title: Prenatal and Infant Exposure to Thimerosal From Vaccines and Immunoglobulins and Risk of Autism
papers.quote: This study revealed no increased risk of ASD associated with receipt of thimerosal-containing vaccines

papers.title: Prevalence of Pervasive Developmental Disorders among Children at the English Montreal School Board
papers.quote: No change in the underlying population trends for PDD rates could be observed in relation to thimerosal discontinuation

papers.title: Thimerosal-Containing Vaccines and Autism: A Review of Recent Epidemiologic Studies
papers.quote: Studies have consistently failed to identify a cause-effect relationship between thimerosal and autism

papers.title: Vaccination of children - a systematic review
papers.quote: MMR vaccination does not cause autism or autism spectrum disorder

papers.title: What causes autism? Exploring the environmental contribution
papers.quote: Taken together, this extensive series of high-quality, peer-reviewed studies has failed to show any association between autism and childhood immunization

papers.title: What Every Behavior Analyst Should Know About the ‚ÄúMMR Causes Autism‚Äù Hypothesis
papers.quote: This, in combination with numerous other studies showing no relation between the MMR vaccine and ASDs [...] provides strong evidence against the "MMR causes autism" hypothesis

papers.title: A Positive Association found between Autism Prevalence and Childhood Vaccination uptake across the U.S. Population
papers.quote: Evidence presented in this paper suggests a possible link between susceptible children receiving a battery of vaccinations and developing autism or speech disorders

notes.title: Anti-vaccine organization
notes.description: The author is on the board of directors and research committee of SafeMinds, an anti-vaccine organization

papers.title: Do aluminum vaccine adjuvants contribute to the rising prevalence of autism?
papers.quote: We show that Al-adjuvanted vaccines may be a significant etiological factor in the rising prevalence of ASD in the Western world

notes.title: Controversial author
notes.description: The second author has a long history of highly criticized and even retracted publications, close relations with several anti-vaccine organizations, and is the senior editor of an anti-vaccine journal

papers.title: Theoretical aspects of autism: Causes - A review
papers.quote: Documented causes of autism include [...] encephalitis following vaccination

notes.title: Strange choices
notes.description: For some reason, the author decided to ignore all the large-scale epidemiological studies that refuted this link and instead focus on indirect hypotheses and speculations from controversial authors and anti-vaccine blogs

papers.title: Dispelling vaccine myths: MMR and considerations for practicing pharmacists
papers.quote: Subsequent well-designed and complete research published on MMR and ASDs has used larger sample sizes and shown no elevated risk between the MMR vaccine and ASDs

papers.title: The combined measles, mumps, and rubella vaccines and the total number of vaccines are not associated with development of autism spectrum disorder: The first case‚Äìcontrol study in Asia
papers.quote: There were not any convincing evidences that MMR vaccination and increasing the number of vaccine injections were associated with an increased risk of ASD

papers.title: A two-phase study evaluating the relationship between Thimerosal-containing vaccine administration and the risk for an autism spectrum disorder diagnosis in the United States
papers.quote: The present study provides new epidemiological evidence supporting an association between increasing organic-Hg exposure from Thimerosal-containing childhood vaccines and the subsequent risk of an ASD diagnosis

papers.quote: In young children, a highly significant correlation exists between the number of pediatric aluminum-adjuvanted vaccines administered and the rate of autism spectrum disorders

notes.title: Controversial author

papers.title: Increasing Exposure to Antibody-Stimulating Proteins and Polysaccharides in Vaccines Is Not Associated with Risk of Autism
papers.quote: Increasing exposure to antibody-stimulating proteins and polysaccharides in vaccines during the first 2 years of life was not related to the risk of developing an ASD

papers.title: Response to measles-mumps-rubella vaccine in children with autism spectrum disorders.
papers.quote: Our results support the arguments against a role of MMR vaccination as a causal factor or co-factor in development of ASD

papers.title: A meta-analysis of the evidence on the impact of prenatal and early infancy exposures to mercury on autism and attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder in the childhood
papers.quote: The current findings suggest that mercury exposures on embryos or early infants from thimerosal containing vaccine are not significantly associated with an increased risk of ASD or ADHD/ADD

papers.title: Measles-mumps-rubella vaccination timing and autism among young african american boys: a reanalysis of CDC data
papers.quote: The present study provides new epidemiologic evidence showing that African American males receiving the MMR vaccine prior to 24 months of age or 36 months of age are more likely to receive an autism diagnosis

notes.title: Undisclosed conflict of interest
notes.description: Translational Neurodegeneration refers to an undeclared competing interest as one of the reasons for the paper's retraction

notes.title: Statistical analysis validity
notes.description: "Reanalysis" of data from a study that found no link, case-control data analyzed using a cohort method, lots of subgroups created to increase the chances of false positives

notes.title: Anti-vaccine activist
notes.description: The author is an anti-vaccine activist

papers.title: Safety of Vaccines Used for Routine Immunization of US Children: A Systematic Review
papers.quote: There is strong evidence that MMR vaccine is not associated with autism

papers.title: Vaccines are not associated with autism: An evidence-based meta-analysis of case-control and cohort studies
papers.quote:
This meta-analysis of five case-control and five cohort studies has found no evidence for the link between vaccination and the
subsequent risk of developing autism or autistic spectrum disorder

papers.title: Administration of thimerosal-containing vaccines to infant rhesus macaques does not result in autism-like behavior or neuropathology
papers.quote: These data indicate that administration of TCVs and/or the MMR vaccine to rhesus macaques does not result in neuropathological abnormalities, or aberrant behaviors, like those observed in ASD

papers.title: Autism Occurrence by MMR Vaccine Status Among US Children With Older Siblings With and Without Autism
papers.quote: MMR vaccine receipt was not associated with an increased risk of ASD at any age

papers.title: Early exposure to the combined measles-mumps-rubella vaccine and thimerosal-containing vaccines and risk of autism spectrum disorder
papers.quote: No convincing evidence was found in this study that MMR vaccination and increasing thimerosal dose were associated with an increased risk of ASD onset

papers.title: Examination of the Safety of Pediatric Vaccine Schedules in a Non-Human Primate Model: Assessments of Neurodevelopment, Learning, and Social Behavior
papers.quote: This comprehensive 5-year case-control study [...] provided no consistent evidence of neurodevelopmental deficits or aberrant behavior in vaccinated animals

papers.title: Vaccine Safety: Medical Contraindications, Myths, and Risk Communication
papers.quote: On the basis of strong evidence, neither measles-mumps-rubella vaccine nor thimerosal causes autism

papers.title: Annual Research Review: The role of the environment in the developmental psychopathology of autism spectrum condition
papers.quote: Many large-scale epidemiological studies have refuted the idea that MMR vaccine [...] or thiomersal-containing vaccines [...] act as postnatal risks for the incidence of ASC

papers.title: Association Between Influenza Infection and Vaccination During Pregnancy and Risk of Autism Spectrum Disorder
papers.quote: Maternal influenza infection during pregnancy was not associated with increased ASD risk in this study

papers.title: Measles and Measles Vaccination
papers.quote: There is no link between the measles vaccination and autism

papers.title: Parental report of vaccine receipt in children with autism spectrum disorder: Do rates differ by pattern of ASD onset?
papers.quote: Findings do not support a connection between regressive-onset ASD and vaccines in this cohort

papers.title: Environmental risk factors for autism: an evidence-based review of systematic reviews and meta-analyses
papers.quote: Current evidence suggests that several environmental factors including vaccination, [...] thimerosal exposure, [...] are unrelated to risk of ASD

papers.title: Increased risk for an atypical autism diagnosis following Thimerosal-containing vaccine exposure in the United States: A prospective longitudinal case-control study in the Vaccine Safety Datalink
papers.quote: The present study provides important epidemiological evidence significantly associating increasing Hg exposure from Thimerosal containing childhood vaccines and the subsequent risk of atypical autism diagnosis

notes.title: Controversial authors
notes.description: The first and last authors have a long history of highly criticized and even retracted publications, undisclosed conflicts of interest, dishonesty, data manipulation, and revoked medical licenses

notes.title: Questionable bibliography
notes.description: The authors describe the extensive literature of large-scale epistemological studies as "a few epidemiological studies", and claim that they have been strongly criticized by referring only to their own papers

notes.title: Most vaccines now mercury-free
notes.description: The paper focuses on the effects of mercury, which has now been removed from most vaccines

papers.title: Pilot comparative study on the health of vaccinated and unvaccinated 6- to 12- year old U.S. children
papers.quote: Vaccination was associated with an apparent synergistic increase in the odds of NDD

notes.title: Data quality
notes.description: All health and vaccination data were based on an anonymous online questionnaire with no clinical verification, and recruitment was conducted through homeschool networks that explicitly mentioned the study‚Äôs background

notes.title: Anti-vaccine funding
notes.description: The study was supported by grants from anti-vaccine organizations like Generation Rescue or the Children‚Äôs Medical Safety Research Institute

notes.title: Retraction history
notes.description: The paper has been retracted twice and is currently available in a predatory journal

papers.title: Vaccine Adverse Events: Separating Myth from Reality
papers.quote: Multiple studies have found no causal link between vaccination and autism

papers.title: Adverse events of vaccines and the consequences of non-vaccination: a critical review
authors: Luana Raposo de Melo Moraes Aps
papers.quote: No causal relationship has been demonstrated between the administration of vaccines and autism

papers.title: Current status of vaccines in psychiatry - A narrative review
papers.quote: No evidence was found to suggest an association between Autism and MMR /Thiomersal vaccination

papers.title: Prenatal Tetanus, Diphtheria, Acellular Pertussis Vaccination and Autism Spectrum Disorder
papers.quote: Prenatal Tdap vaccination was not associated with an increased risk of autism spectrum disorder (ASD)

papers.title: The contribution of environmental exposure to the etiology of autism spectrum disorder
papers.quote: Epidemiological studies demonstrate no evidence for vaccination posing an autism risk

papers.title: Measles, Mumps, Rubella Vaccination and Autism
papers.quote: The study strongly supports that MMR vaccination does not increase the risk for autism, does not trigger autism in susceptible children, and is not associated with clustering of autism cases after vaccination

papers.title: Measles, Mumps, Rubella Vaccination and Autism
papers.quote: The study strongly supports that MMR vaccination does not increase the risk for autism

papers.title: Principal Controversies in Vaccine Safety in the United States
papers.quote: The evidence is strong that MMR vaccine does not cause autism

papers.title: The MMR Vaccine and Autism
papers.quote: Several epidemiologic studies have not found an association between MMR vaccination and autism

papers.title: Maternal Influenza A(H1N1) Immunization During Pregnancy and Risk for Autism Spectrum Disorder in Offspring
papers.quote: This large cohort study found no association between maternal H1N1 vaccination during pregnancy and risk for ASD in the offspring

papers.title: Multiple Risk Factors: A Challenge in the Management of Autism
papers.quote: No association of autism could be found with vaccines in recent studies

papers.title: The science of vaccine safety: Summary of meeting at Wellcome Trust
papers.quote: No well-designed study ever supported a risk association of autism with vaccines, and the convergence of negative findings across investigators, study designs, samples and countries has been impressive

papers.title: Vaccine Safety: Myths and Misinformation
papers.quote: Multiple large scale studies, including a study of half a million children have shown no association between receipt of MMR and risk of autism

papers.title: Review: Vaccine Myth-Buster - Cleaning Up With Prejudices and Dangerous Misinformation
papers.quote: There is no evidence for an association between vaccines and autism

papers.title: Reviewing the association between aluminum adjuvants in the vaccines and autism spectrum disorder
papers.quote: This review of lines of evidence in support of the hypothesis that aluminum adjuvants in vaccines might be a causal factor in neurodevelopmental disorders concludes that this correlation is clear

papers.title: Safety of vaccines used for routine immunization in the United States: An updated systematic review and meta-analysis
papers.quote: Strength of evidence was high for no increased risk of autism following measles, mumps, and rubella (MMR) vaccine

papers.title: The myth of vaccination and autism spectrum
papers.quote: Despite the overwhelming data demonstrating that there is no link between vaccines and autism, many parents are hesitant to immunize their children because of the alleged association

papers.title: Vaccine safety issues at the turn of the 21st century
papers.quote: The Committee found a lack of association between different vaccinations or ingredients and autism

papers.title: Vaccines for measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella in children
papers.quote: Our review shows that MMR, MMRV and MMR+V vaccines are effective [...] with no evidence of an increased risk of autism

papers.title: Does Vaccination Increase the Risk of Autism Spectrum Disorder?
papers.quote: According to our review, there is no link between the development of ASD and immunization

papers.title: Prenatal Influenza Vaccination or Influenza Infection and Autism Spectrum Disorder in Offspring
papers.quote: Prenatal influenza vaccination or infection was not associated with ASD risk in offspring

papers.title: Environmental Risk Factors in Autism Spectrum Disorder: A Narrative Review
papers.quote: The evidence presented in this paper suggests that certain factors, such as vaccination, [...] are not linked to ASD risk

papers.title: Prenatal Exposure to COVID-19 mRNA Vaccine BNT162b2 Induces Autism-Like Behaviors in Male Neonatal Rats: Insights into WNT and BDNF Signaling Perturbations
papers.quote: Our research provides insights into the effects of the COVID-19 mRNA BNT162b2 vaccine on WNT gene expression, BDNF levels, and certain neurodevelopmental markers in a rat model

notes.title: Same with natural infection
notes.description: The interpretation given by the authors implies that we should expect the same phenomenon, if not worse, with a real infection

papers.title: The vaccine-autism connection: No link, still debate, and we are failing to learn the lessons
papers.quote: Extensive reviews and large-scale studies have consistently demonstrated no association between autism and the MMR vaccine or vaccine components like thimerosal
